result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 9:30am 
Defendant Austin Edward Schmit appears by videoconferencing from the Dane County Jail, in custody. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Nelson provides an update on efforts to reach a resolution of the case; she requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Mr. Scmit indicates that he anticipates still being in custody on the next date and he is in agreement with appearing by videoconferencing for the next hearing.

[ma] Case called at 9:10 AM   {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
Defendant Austin Edward Schmit appears from the Dane County Jail. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears.  Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr. Schmit waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:

--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

[ma] Case called at 1:48 PM   {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
Defendant Austin Edward Schmit appears via videoconferencing from the Dane County Jail, in custody. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000  Signature Bond with condition:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

The Court quashes warrant. 
recess 1:52 pm.
